intro: Henriettea cuabae, commonly known as the Congo buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant features palmately divided leaves and produces small, aggregate fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
